授業目的: Each student is expected to work on advisor-approved projects that will challenge the student to learn new things about digital technologies and use those technologies in positive ways to affect our digital society in positive manners. Although the main topic of the seminar is related to technology, not all students are expected to become technologies.  As a matter-of-fact, it is expected and anticipated that some of the students will work on other spects such as technology policy and entrepreneurship.  This year, some of those technologies include table-PC platforms, smart phones, educational technologies and much more.
到達目標:
Students will:
1) Work on advisor-directed research projects
2) Learn useful research techniques based on the scientific method
3) Work on groups of 2 or more to develop their research themes more efficiently
4) Write academic undergraduate thesis using standard writing tools
5) Programming skills
6) Surveying skills

トピック.授業計画1:
Students are expected to attend every single seminar class meetings. There will be status updates at the beginning of those meetings in which each student will describe research and study progress during the previous week. According to the projects the students are involved in, the students will then spend the rest of the seminar class time advancing further their study and research under the close supervision of the instructor. At times, seminar meetings might take place outside of the seminar room and at times during weekends. All students will be expected to attend the following two research presentation venues:
1) Spring Research Consortium
2) Fall Research Fair
トピック.授業外学習2: Learn about current technologies you are interested on the web, newspapers and magazines.
